abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Structural Adjustment
            Loan and Credit Project was rated as satisfactory. Key
            lessons learned include: a) Challenging reform targets can
            be an important stimulus to action. b) The project should
            have included a follow-up/monitoring mechanism by which the
            Government could have verified that reforms introduced were
            continuing to be implemented, provided assistance to
            complete and strengthen reforms, and provided a procedure by
            which to sustain a dialogue on continuing and deepening
            reforms. c) The Government needs to take action to ensure
            that various agencies move with equal speed to implement
            reforms agreed. d) Sector strategy and reforms should be
            formulated as part of a long-term vision to guide the
            government and to provide the basis for sustainability. e)
            Coordination among donors is crucial to avoid gaps and
            overlaps, and ensure that contributions are focused on
            achieving the objectives.
